columns.name: id
columns.description: A unique identification of aspecific Materialspecification.

columns.name: description
columns.description: Contains additional informationand descriptions of the Material specification definition.

columns.name: hierarchyScope
columns.description: Identifies where the exchanged information fits within the role-based Material hierarchy. Optionally, hierarchy scope defines the scope of the Material class definition, such as the site or area where it is defined.

columns.name: storageLocation
columns.description: Identifies the storage locationof the Material resource(s)specified by this Material specification.

columns.name: storageLocationType
columns.description: Indicates whether the storagelocation attribute refers to anoperational location, equipmentor physical asset object, orcontains a description of thestorage location.Mandatory where a storagelocation is specified.Defined values are operational location: storagelocation attribute referencesan operational location; equipment: storage locationattribute references anequipment object;physical asset: storagelocation attribute references aphysical asset; and description: storage locationattribute contains adescription of the storagelocation, such as a streetaddress.

columns.name: assemblyType
columns.description: Defines the type of the assembly.Defined types are - physical: the components ofthe assembly are physicallyconnected or in the samearea;logical: the components of theassembly are not necessarilyphysically connected or in thesame area.

columns.name: assemblyRelationship
columns.description: Defines the type of therelationships.Defined types are - permanent: an assembly thatis not intended to be splitduring the production process;transient: a temporaryassembly using duringproduction, such as a pallet ofdifferent materials or a batchkit.

columns.name: materialUse
columns.description: Defines the expected use of thematerial class, material definition,material lot, or material sublot inthe context of the operationsegment.Defined values for productionoperations areconsumable, material consumed,material produced, by-productproduced, co-product produced,and yield produced.Defined values for maintenanceoperations areconsumable, material consumed,and material produced.Defined values for quality testoperations areconsumable, destructive sample,returned sample, and retainedsample.Defined values for Inventoryoperations areconsumable, material consumed,material produced, andinventoried.

columns.name: quantity
columns.description: Specifies the quantity of Material resourcerequired for the parent operationssegment.

columns.name: quantityUnitOfMeasure
columns.description: The unit of measure of theassociated quantity.

columns.name: inventorysystemrefid
columns.description: Inventory/ERP System of Record Identifier for Material (AssetID)

columns.name: messystemrefid
columns.description: Manufacturing system Ref ID (MES Person Referrence ID)

dtdlSchema.description: Material resources that are required for a operations segment shall be presented as material specifications
dtdlSchema.comment: According to ANSI/ISA-95.00.02-2018 Enterprise-Control System Integration âˆ’ Part 2: Objects and Attributes for - Approved 24 May 2018

contents.name: IsAssembledFrom
contents.description: The related object(s) makes up part of this material specification as the whole

contents.name: specifies
contents.description: The test specification(s) used to evaluate this testable object.

contents.name: hasPropertiesOf
contents.description: The material specification property(s) of this material specification

contents.name: correspondsToClass
contents.description: A cross-model association to element in the material model as explained in Clause 3.3.8. Identifies the associated material class or set of material classes of the specification for a specific process segment

contents.name: correspondsToDefinition
contents.description: A cross-model association to element in the material model as explained in Clause 3.3.8. Identifies the associated material definition or set of material definition of the specification for a specific process segment

contents.name: correspondsToLot
contents.description: A cross-model association to element in the material model as explained in Clause 3.3.8. Identifies the associated material lot or set of material lot of the specification for a specific process segment

contents.name: correspondsToSublot
contents.description: A cross-model association to element in the material model as explained in Clause 3.3.8. Identifies the associated material sublot or set of material sublot of the specification for a specific process segment. Typically, either a material class or material definition is specified

contents.name: description
contents.description: Additional information about the process segment

contents.name: hierarchyScope
contents.description: Identifies where the exchanged information fits within the role based equipment hierarchy.

contents.name: hierarchyScopeRel
contents.comment: Not part of the Standard Specs.

contents.name: spatialDefinition
contents.description: Spatially defines the equipment as a zero-dimensional point, one dimensional line, or two dimensional shape or three dimensional solid.

contents.name: storageLocation
contents.description: Identifies the storage location of  the material resource(s) specified by this material segment specification

contents.name: storageLocationType
contents.description: Indicates whether the storage location attribute refers to an operational location, equipment or physical asset object, or contains a description of the storage location
contents.comment: Mandatory where a storage location is specified

enumValues.name: operationalLocation
enumValues.comment: storage location attribute references an operational location

enumValues.name: equipment
enumValues.comment: storage location attribute references an equipment object

enumValues.name: physicalAsset
enumValues.comment: storage location attribute references a physical asset

enumValues.name: description
enumValues.comment: storage location attribute contains a description of the storage location, such as a street address

contents.name: assemblyType
contents.description: Defines the type of the assembly

enumValues.name: physical
enumValues.description: the components of the assembly are physically connected or in the same area

enumValues.name: logical
enumValues.description: the components of the assembly are not necessarily physically connected or in the same area

contents.name: assemblyRelationship
contents.description: Defines the type of the relationships

enumValues.name: permanent
enumValues.description: an assembly that is not intended to be split during the production process

enumValues.name: transient
enumValues.description: a temporary assembly using during production, such as a pallet of different materials or a batch kit

contents.name: materialUse
contents.description: Defines the expected use of the material class, material definition, material lot, or material sublot in the context of the process segment.

contents.name: quantity
contents.description: Specifies the personnel resource required for the parent process segment

contents.name: quantityUnitOfMeasure
contents.description: The unit of measure of the associated quantity
